pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:0.5.eng: 17. The training rule on having wool washed

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ nigrodhārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying in the Sakyan country in the Banyan Tree Monastery at Kapilavatthu.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhunīhi eḷakalomāni dhovāpentipi rajāpentipi vijaṭāpentipi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six had the nuns wash, dye, and comb wool.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.3.pli: Bhikkhuniyo eḷakalomāni dhovantiyo rajantiyo vijaṭentiyo riñcanti uddesaṃ paripucchaṃ adhisīlaṃ adhicittaṃ adhipaññaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.3.eng: Because of this, the nuns neglected recitation, testing, the higher morality, the higher mind, and the higher wisdom.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.3.comm: “Testing” renders paripuccha. The basic meaning of paripucchā is “to question” or “to ask”, as used for instance in Bu Pc 71. Often, however, as in the present case, it refers to a teacher questioning his student, in the sense of finding out how much the student knows. In such cases I render the word as “testing”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.4.pli: Atha kho mahāpajāpati gotamī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.4.eng: Mahāpajāpati Gotamī then went to the Buddha and bowed down to him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.5.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhitaṃ kho mahāpajāpatiṃ gotamiṃ bhagavā etadavoca—“kacci, gotami, bhikkhuniyo appamattā ātāpiniyo pahitattā viharantī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.5.eng: And the Buddha said to her, “Gotamī, I hope the nuns are heedful, energetic, and diligent?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.6.eng: “How could the nuns be heedful, venerable sir?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.7.pli: Ayyā chabbaggiyā bhikkhunīhi eḷakalomāni dhovāpentipi rajāpentipi vijaṭāpentipi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.7.eng: And she told him what was happening.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.8.pli: Bhikkhuniyo eḷakalomāni dhovantiyo rajantiyo vijaṭentiyo riñcanti uddesaṃ paripucchaṃ adhisīlaṃ adhicittaṃ adhipaññan”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.9.pli: Atha kho bhagavā mahāpajāpatiṃ gotamiṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.9.eng: The Buddha then instructed, inspired, and gladdened her with a teaching.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.10.pli: Atha kho mahāpajāpati gotamī bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṃsitā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.10.eng: She bowed down, circumambulated him with her right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.11.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā chabbaggiye bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.11.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks from the group of six:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.12.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, bhikkhunīhi eḷakalomāni dhovāpethapi rajāpethapi vijaṭāpethapī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.12.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.16.pli: “Aññātakā, moghapurisā, aññātikānaṃ na jānanti patirūpaṃ vā appatirūpaṃ vā pāsādikaṃ vā apāsādikaṃ vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.16.eng: “Foolish men, people who are unrelated don’t know what’s appropriate and inappropriate, what’s inspiring and uninspiring, in dealing with each other.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.17.pli: Tattha nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, aññātikāhi bhikkhunīhi eḷakalomāni dhovāpessathapi rajāpessathapi vijaṭāpessathapi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.19.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.19.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.20.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā eḷakalomāni dhovāpeyya vā rajāpeyya vā vijaṭāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:1.20.1.eng: ‘If a monk has an unrelated nun wash, dye, or comb wool, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.6.pli: mātito vā pitito vā yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā asambaddhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.6.eng: anyone who is not a descendant of one’s male ancestors going back eight generations, either on the mother’s side or on the father’s side.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.6.comm: Sp 1.505: Tattha yāva sattamā pitāmahayugāti pitupitā pitāmaho, pitāmahassa yugaṁ pitāmahayugaṁ, “In this yāva sattamā pitāmahayuga means: the father of a father is a grandfather. The generation of a grandfather is called a pitāmahayuga.” So the PaIi phrase yāva sattamā pitāmahayuga means “as far as the seventh generation of grandfathers”, that is, eight generations back. This can be counted as follows: (1) one’s grandfather; (2) his father; (3) 2’s father; (4) 3’s father; (5) 4’s father; (6) 5’s father; and (7) 6’s father. This applies to both one’s paternal and maternal grandfathers. This gives a total of 14 ancestors. Anyone who is a descendent of these fourteen is considered a relative. Anyone who is not such a descendent is not regarded as a relative.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.8.eng: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.9.eng: If he tells her to wash it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.10.eng: When it has been washed, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.11.eng: If he tells her to dye it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.12.eng: When it has been dyed, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.13.eng: If he tells her to comb it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.14.eng: When it has been combed, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.15.pli: Nissajjitabbāni saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.15.eng: The wool should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.16.eng: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.17.eng: (To be expanded as in Bu NP 1:3.2.5–3.2.29, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.18.pli: “imāni me, bhante, eḷakalomāni aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā dhovāpitāni nissaggiyāni.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.18.eng: ‘Venerables, this wool, which I got washed by an unrelated nun, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.19.eng: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.22.eng: ‘I give this wool back to you.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.23.1.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī eḷakalomāni dhovāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.23.1.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her wash wool, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.24.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī eḷakalomāni dhovāpeti rajāpeti, nissaggiyena āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.24.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her wash and dye wool, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.25.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī eḷakalomāni dhovāpeti vijaṭāpeti, nissaggiyena āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.25.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her wash and comb wool, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.26.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī eḷakalomāni dhovāpeti rajāpeti vijaṭāpeti, nissaggiyena āpatti dvinnaṃ dukkaṭānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.26.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her wash, dye, and comb wool, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and two offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.27.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī eḷakalomāni rajāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.27.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her dye wool, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.28.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī eḷakalomāni rajāpeti vijaṭāpeti, nissaggiyena āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.28.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her dye and comb wool, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.29.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī eḷakalomāni rajāpeti dhovāpeti, nissaggiyena āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.29.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her dye and wash wool, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.30.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī eḷakalomāni rajāpeti vijaṭāpeti dhovāpeti, nissaggiyena āpatti dvinnaṃ dukkaṭānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.30.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her dye, comb, and wash wool, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and two offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.31.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī eḷakalomāni vijaṭāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.31.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her comb wool, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.32.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī eḷakalomāni vijaṭāpeti dhovāpeti, nissaggiyena āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.32.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her comb and wash wool, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.33.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī eḷakalomāni vijaṭāpeti rajāpeti, nissaggiyena āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.33.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her comb and dye wool, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.34.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī eḷakalomāni vijaṭāpeti dhovāpeti rajāpeti, nissaggiyena āpatti dvinnaṃ dukkaṭānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.34.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her comb, wash, and dye wool, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and two offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.35.eng: If she is unrelated, but he is unsure of it …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.36.eng: If she is unrelated, but he perceives her as related …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.37.eng: If he has her wash wool belonging to someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.38.eng: If he has a nun who is fully ordained only on one side do the washing, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.39.eng: If she is related, but he perceives her as unrelated, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.40.eng: If she is related, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.41.eng: If she is related and he perceives her as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.43.eng: if a related nun does the washing and an unrelated nun helps her;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.44.eng: if a nun does the washing without being asked;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.45.eng: if he has a nun wash an unused and finished article;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.46.eng: if it is a trainee nun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.47.eng: if it is a novice nun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.49.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np17:2.50.eng: The training rule on having wool washed, the seventh, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upanando sakyaputto aññatarassa kulassa kulūpako hoti niccabhattiko.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.2.eng: At that time Venerable Upananda was associating with a family from which he received a regular meal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.3.pli: Yaṃ tasmiṃ kule uppajjati khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā tato āyasmato upanandassa sakyaputtassa paṭiviso ṭhapiyyati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.3.eng: Whenever that family obtained food, they put aside a portion for Upananda.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāyaṃ tasmiṃ kule maṃsaṃ uppannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.4.eng: And that’s what they did when one evening they obtained some meat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.5.pli: Tato āyasmato upanandassa sakyaputtassa paṭiviso ṭhapito hoti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.6.pli: Tassa kulassa dārako rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya rodati—“maṃsaṃ me dethā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.6.eng: The following morning their son got up early and cried, “Give me meat!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.7.pli: Atha kho so puriso pajāpatiṃ etadavoca—“ayyassa paṭivisaṃ dārakassa dehi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.7.eng: The man said to his wife, “Give him the venerable’s portion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.8.eng: We’ll buy something else for the venerable.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.9.pli: Atha kho āyasmā upanando sakyaputto pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaraṃ ādāya yena taṃ kulaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.9.eng: On the same morning Upananda robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to that family where he sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.10.pli: Atha kho so puriso yenāyasmā upanando sakyaputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ upanandaṃ sakyaputtaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so puriso āyasmantaṃ upanandaṃ sakyaputtaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.10.eng: The man of the house approached Upananda, bowed, sat down, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.11.pli: “hiyyo kho, bhante, sāyaṃ maṃsaṃ uppannaṃ ahosi. Tato ayyassa paṭiviso ṭhapito.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.11.eng: “Yesterday evening, venerable, we obtained some meat, and we put aside a portion for you.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.12.pli: Ayaṃ, bhante, dārako rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya rodati—‘maṃsaṃ me dethā’ti. Ayyassa paṭiviso dārakassa dinno.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.12.eng: But then in the morning our son got up early and cried, ‘Give me meat!’ and we gave him your portion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.13.eng: What can we get you for a kahāpaṇa?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.14.eng: “Are you giving up a kahāpaṇa coin for me?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.16.eng: “Then just give me that kahāpaṇa.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.17.pli: Atha kho so puriso āyasmato upanandassa sakyaputtassa kahāpaṇaṃ datvā ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—“Yatheva mayaṃ rūpiyaṃ paṭiggaṇhāma evamevime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā rūpiyaṃ paṭiggaṇhantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.17.eng: After giving a kahāpaṇa to Upananda, that man complained and criticized him, “The Sakyan monastics accept money just as we do.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.18.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tassa purisassa ujjhāyantassa khiyyantassa vipācentassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.18.eng: The monks heard the complaints of that man,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.19.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.19.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.20.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā upanando sakyaputto rūpiyaṃ paṭiggahessatī”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.21.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ upanandaṃ sakyaputtaṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.21.eng: After rebuking him in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Upananda:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.22.eng: “Is it true, Upananda, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.25.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, rūpiyaṃ paṭiggahessasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.25.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.27.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.27.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.28.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu jātarūparajataṃ uggaṇheyya vā uggaṇhāpeyya vā upanikkhittaṃ vā sādiyeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.28.1.eng: ‘If a monk takes, has someone else take, or consents to gold, silver, or money being deposited for him, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:1.28.1.comm: “Gold, silver, or money” renders jātarūparajata. For a discussion of this compound, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.6.eng: that which has the color of the Teacher is what is meant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.8.pli: kahāpaṇo lohamāsako dārumāsako jatumāsako ye vohāraṃ gacchanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.8.eng: a kahāpaṇa coin, a copper māsaka coin, a wooden māsaka coin, a resin māsaka coin—whatever is used in commerce.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.10.eng: if he takes hold of it himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.12.eng: if he has another take hold of it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.13.eng: Consents to … being deposited for him:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.14.pli: idaṃ ayyassa hotūti upanikkhittaṃ sādiyati, nissaggiyaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.14.eng: if someone says, “This is for you,” and he consents to it being deposited for him, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.15.eng: It should be relinquished in the midst of the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.16.eng: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.17.pli: tena bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.17.eng: After approaching the Sangha, that monk should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior monks. He should then squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.20.eng: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.21.eng: After relinquishing it, he is to confess the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.22.eng: The confession should be received by a competent and capable monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.23.pli: Sace tattha āgacchati ārāmiko vā upāsako vā so vattabbo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.23.eng: If a monastery worker or a lay follower is available, you should tell him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.26.eng: “What can I get you with this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.29.eng: one should point out what is allowable:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.30.pli: sappi vā telaṃ vā madhu vā phāṇitaṃ vā.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.31.pli: Sace so tena parivattetvā kappiyaṃ āharati rūpiyappaṭiggāhakaṃ ṭhapetvā sabbeheva paribhuñjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.31.eng: If he makes a purchase and brings back what is allowable, everyone may enjoy it except the one who received the money.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.32.eng: If this is what happens, all is well.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.33.eng: If not, he should be told,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.35.eng: If he discards it, all is well.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.36.pli: no ce chaḍḍeti, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu rūpiyachaḍḍako sammannitabbo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.36.eng: If he does not, a monk who has five qualities should be appointed as the money discarder:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.37.pli: yo na chandāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na dosāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na mohāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na bhayāgatiṃ gaccheyya, chaḍḍitāchaḍḍitañca jāneyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.37.eng: one who is not biased by desire, ill will, confusion, or fear, and who knows what has and has not been discarded.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.38.eng: “And, monks, this is how he should be appointed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.39.eng: First the monk should be asked

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.40.pli: Yācitvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.40.eng: and then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.41.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.42.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ rūpiyachaḍḍakaṃ sammanneyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.42.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should appoint monk so-and-so as the money discarder.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.44.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.45.eng: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so as the money discarder.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.46.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno rūpiyachaḍḍakassa sammuti, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.46.eng: Any monk who agrees to appointing monk so-and-so as the money discarder should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.47.eng: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.48.eng: The Sangha has appointed monk so-and-so as the money discarder.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.49.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.51.pli: Tena sammatena bhikkhunā animittaṃ katvā pātetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.51.eng: The appointed monk should throw it away without taking note of where.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.52.pli: Sace nimittaṃ katvā pāteti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.52.eng: If he takes note of where he throws it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.53.1.pli: Rūpiye rūpiyasaññī rūpiyaṃ paṭiggaṇhāti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.53.1.eng: If it is money, and he perceives it as such, and he receives it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.54.pli: Rūpiye vematiko rūpiyaṃ paṭiggaṇhāti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.54.eng: If it is money, but he is unsure of it, and he receives it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.55.pli: Rūpiye arūpiyasaññī rūpiyaṃ paṭiggaṇhāti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.55.eng: If it is money, but he does not perceive it as such, and he receives it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.56.eng: If it is not money, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.57.eng: If it is not money, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.58.eng: If it is not money, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.60.pli: ajjhārāme vā ajjhāvasathe vā uggahetvā vā uggahāpetvā vā nikkhipati—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.60.eng: if, within a monastery or a lodging, he takes it or has someone take it, and he then puts it aside with the thought,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.61.eng: “Whoever owns it will come and get it;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.63.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np18:2.64.eng: The training rule on money, the eighth, is finished.
